text: Barbara Radding Morgan (born November 28, 1951) is an American teacher and a former NASA astronaut. She participated in the Teacher in Space program as backup to Christa McAuliffe for the 1986 ill-fated STS-51-L mission of the Space Shuttle Challenger. She then trained as a Mission Specialist, and flew on STS-118 in August 2007. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:Educators from California Category:American astronauts Category:Scientists from Fresno, California
title: Barbara Morgan
